title: Motion study in action
creator_credit: Ralph Barnes and University of Iowa
brief_description: Shows principles of motion economy applied to many kinds of manual work. Old and new methods are shown for twelve different jobs, including the following: Sorting incoming orders; assembling and attaching buckles on shoes; opening cartons; placing pies in bags and filling glasses with ice and water.
